comments.body: can you alph these...? kind of hard to compare whats changed

I'm not sure what you mean. For this file I have:
- Added `declare global { }` enclosure
- Updated the comments in the file header
- Added comment strings after each argument (which I prefer, but I'm not sure about the TS crowd)
Git didn't detect the rename because the file changed too much, presumably. Changes look OK to me.
its easier to search and browse through the list... when there's no easy functional grouping alph is preferred IMO :)
Fair point. If you want to open a PR to alphabetize these I would approve it.

Right now I conserved the order from the documentation site of the library (http://ionden.com/a/plugins/ion.rangeSlider/en.html) which has some loose ordering based on functionality. If alphabetical is preferred, I don't mind opening a new pull request

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +19,23 @@
export interface IonRangeSliderOptions {
    type?: string;    // Choose slider type, could be `single` - for one handle, or `double` for two handles [Default: single]
    min?: number;    // Set slider minimum value [Default: 10]
    max?: number;    // Set slider maximum value [Default: 100]
